intro: Spilanthes montana, commonly known as the mountain bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, and its leaves are pinnately divided with a hairy texture. Spilanthes montana is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It is also known for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in herbal medicine.
